resource.name: Localhost OpenDJ
resource.description:
LDAP resource using an Identity Connector Framework LDAP connector. It contains configuration for use with stock OpenDJ and OpenDS servers.
This resource definition contains also definition to enable synchronization and especially an expression that is using a lookup of value from an configuration object.

connectorRef.description: Reference to the ICF LDAP connector. This is dynamic reference, it will be translated to OID during import.

attribute.description: Definition of "name" attribute handling. LDAP ICF connector will put entry DN into "name" attribute. This in fact maps to the __NAME__ ICF attribute.

outbound.description:
Outbound expression for the "name" attribute. If account is created or updated, the "name" attribute will be set according to this expression.
This specific expression will construct DN by concatenating name from user object and string constants.
The expression is marked as "default", therefore it will be evaluated only if the entry already does not have an DN.
It is an XPath expression, similar to BPEL assignment expressions.

attribute.description:
Definition of ICF "uid" attribute handling. ICF LDAP connector will put entry UUID into "uid" attribute in case it is connecting to OpenDJ/OpenDS. It may be different for other directory servers and it also dependes on connector configuration. Please see connector documentation for more details.
Do not confuse this attribute with the LDAP "uid". This is an ICF uid which maps to ICF __UID__ attribute. It has a different namespace than the LDAP uid. The definition of LDAP uid is provided below.
Definition of cn attribute handling. This is definition of LDAP "cn" (commonName) attribute.

outbound.description:
Outbound expression here is using "pure" XPath, without using functions. This is the simplest case, just copying the "fullName" property of user to the "cn" attribute of an account.
Please note that this expression is not marked as "default". Therefore this value will be copied on every change, overwriting the original value of "cn" on the resource.

inbound.description: Inbound expression. It is used to synchronize changes in the account to the user object in the IDM. This expression specifies to copy the cn attribute value from the account to the fullName property of the user.
sn will be synchronized to user's familyName
givenName will be synchronized to user's givenName

attribute.description: Definition of LDAP uid attribute handling. This is a native LDAP uid attribute. Do not confuse with ICF uid attribute (__UID__) which has a different namespace.

outbound.description: It is mapped from (and also to) "name" property of user. It is essentially a login name

inbound.description: It is mapped to (and also from) "name" property of user. It is essentially a login name

outbound.description: This outbound expression is not really an expression. It is using a fixed literal insead of dynamically generated value.

attribute.description: Definition of description attribute handling. This attribute is using a lookup table to translate the values valid for user to a values valid for the resource account.

outbound.description: Outbound expression definition. This expression is using a configuration object (set into an XPath variable) to translate values.

expression.description: The expression itself. It translates the value of user's attribute "locality" (expressed as $i:user/i:locality) using a lookup table defined in the configuration object in the $my:config variable specified above.

variable.name: my:config
variable.description: Definition of extra variable for the XPath expression. The variable will appear as "$my:config" in the Xpath expression below. It will contain the content of XML object stored by OID c0c010c0-d34d-b33f-f00d-999111111111.

variable.name: my:defaultLocation
variable.description: Example of setting a variable to a string value.

correlation.description: Correlation expression is a search query. Following search queury will look for users that have "name" equal to the "uid" attribute of the account. Simply speaking, it will look for match in usernames in the IDM and the resource. The correlation rule always looks for users, so it will not match any other object type.

userTemplate.name: Default User Template
userTemplate.description: User Template Object. This object is used when creating a new account, to set it up as needed.

propertyConstruction.description: Property construction. Defines how properties of user object are set up. This specific definition sets a full name as a concatenation of givenName and familyName.

accountConstruction.description: Account construction. Defines what accounts should be assigned to a user when it is created. It only defines resource and account type. The rest of the account parameters are specified by outbound expressions in the account type in the resource definition, as usual. See http://wiki.evolveum.com/display/midPoint/Synchronization

userTemplate.name: Default User Template2
userTemplate.description: Alternative User Template Object. This object is used when creating a new account, to set it up as needed.

propertyConstruction.description: Property construction. Defines how properties of user object are set up. This specific definition sets a full name as a concatenation of givenName and familyName.

genericObject.name: My Sample Config Object
genericObject.description: Sample custom configuration object. Object of the genericObject type are in fact free-form objects. They can contain almost any XML data in the extension part. They are supposed to hold data structures that parametrize the IDM custom business logic or IDM expressions.

task.name: Synchronization: Embedded Test OpenDJ
task.description: Definition of a live sychnronization task. It will poll changelog and pull in changes

unknownJavaObject.toString: Task(id:1327683120569-0-1, name:Import from resource Embedded Test OpenDJ, oid:193371b3-a260-41f5-890b-6c2021907ee9)

xsd:appinfo.r:help: Name of unique attribute in current CSV file.
Flag if connector does have to parse multivalue attributes with char defined in Multivalue delimiter
Delimiter for multivalue attributes in CSV record (escaped as regexp, if needed).
User password attribute name is not required. Its used only in authenticate operation.
Attribute value qualifier in CSV record (escaped as regexp, if needed).
Path to CSV file with records.
Delimiter character between fields in one CSV record (escaped as regexp, if needed).
